attributes.action: Issue tax exemptions for Brexit voters who have had democracy denied and stolen
attributes.additional_details:
Vote Leave won 51.9% of votes in the EU referendum, with a standard deviation of 10.4% across UK local authority areas. A total of 46.5 million voters were registered, and 72.2% of these turned out. Thus, 17.4 million voted to Leave and 16.1 million to Remain.

The Government would be faced with reality - a wake up call 
Lose tax revenue from 17.4M or Act responsibly, execute Brexit (potentially no deal) and restore democracy.
Noting EU is unlikely to give an inch - history clearly shows this.
attributes.background:
The Government, in all their political party guises, have ignored the democratic vote of the people.  We now exist within a dictatorship arrangement. Brexit voters are democrats, as we no longer have that system, why should we pay in (via Taxes).  
Issue Tax exemptions for all Brexit Voters.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.
